question: Snuggle in, sweetie. It's cold out there.
answer: Why is it snowing, grandma? Where does it come from?

question: Oh, that's a long story, sweetheart.
Oh, not tonight. Go to sleep.
answer: I'm not sleepy. Tell me, please.

question: Well, all right. Let's see. I guess it would have to start with scissors.
Well, there are all kinds of scissors. And once there was even a man who had scissors for hands.
Yes.
No, scissorhands. You know the mansion on top of the mountain?

Well, a long time ago, an inventor lived in that mansion. He made many things, I suppose. He also created a man. He gave him inside, a heart, a brain, everything. Well, almost everything. You see, the inventor was very old. He died before he got to finish the man he invented. So the man was left by himself, incomplete and all alone.
Avon calling.
No, not since last season. Today I've come to show you our exquisite new line of soft colors in shadows, blushes and lipstick. Everything you need to accent and highlight your changing looks.
Well, it goes that saying and I also have a complete selection of your old favorites, those tried-and-true products we've all come to depend on year-in and year-out.
answer: Come on, Peg. I never buy anything from you. You know that?

question: I know. Bye, Helen.
answer: I could? I don't think so. You know, on TV they say you repairmen are lonely bunch of people. Housewives get lonely too. Although you may not realize it since they haven't made a commercial on the subject. On no! Who could that be? Will you excuse me for a moment? Now. Don't go anywhere. I'll be right back. This is fascinating. I wouldn't want to miss a moment of it.

question: Good morning, Joyce. Avon calling.
answer: Why! Peg. Have you gone blind? Can't you see there's a vehicle in my driveway?

question: Oh, yes.
answer: Well, I'm surprised you don't realize that means I'm busy.

question: Okay. Now, we should decide on lipsticks. Okay, dear, what one did you like best? There was the Winsome Wahini which looked charming on you. Or the Bahenie Bliss.
Well, great.
answer: You don't actually think I have any money, do you?

question: It's just not my day. Oh, my goodness. Oh, it's so beautiful. Hello? Hello? Avon calling, oh my. Hello, I'm Peg Boggs. I'm your local Avon representative. Hello. I'm sorry to barge in like this. But you don't have any reason to be afraid. This is some huge house, isn't it? Thank goodness for those aerobics classes. Hello. Hello. Why are you hiding back there? You don't have to hide from me. I'm Peg Boggs. I'm your local Avon representative and I'm as harmless as cherry pie. Oh my! I can see that I've disturbed you. How stupid of me! I'll just be going now.
Oh my! What happened to you?
Uh, put those down. Don't come any closer. Just please... Those are your hands? Those are your hands. What happened to you? Where are your parents? Hum... Your mother? Your father?

Are you alone? Do you live up here all by yourself? What happened to your face? Hum, you know, I won't hurt you. But at the very least let me give you a good astringent and this will help to prevent infection. What's your name?
Edward? I think you should just come home with me. Oh!
No, Don't be. You go ahead and look you have every reason to be excited. Oh! Are you ok?
Hello.
answer: Hi, it's Margie. Listen, I was standing outside talking to Carol and Peg drove by, she had somebody in the car.

question: Did you get a good look?
answer: No, did she say anything to you, about having guest?

question: She didn't say anything. She rang my doorbell early this morning.
answer: No, ok, I'll meet you on the corner. Right, Bye.

question: Here we are. So, oh, this is the living room and back here, the bedrooms. You want to see the pictures? All right. Well, this is my husband, Bill. He's a bowling champion. Do you know what bowling is? Bowling? Well, here they are down at the lake, fishing. I think Kevin looks a little glum Because they didn't catch anything that day. And here's my daughter, Kim. All dressed up the junior prom. She's a senior now. I can't believe it. She's camping in the mountains with some friends, but she'll be back in a few days and you can meet her then. Isn't she beautiful? That's my family. Now, go on, dear. I'll show you the rest of the house. Then you can just freshen up and make yourself at home. Okay? That's the kitchen over there. You help yourself to anything you want to eat or drink. Those are grapes. Back here are the bedrooms. Let me get you some towels, then I will see what we can find to wear. You know what? I think I have some of Bill's old clothes in here. This is perfect. Here. These should just fit you. Oh, no, no. Don't be alarmed. That's just a phone. Now you can go in Kim's room and put these on. I'll be right with you. No, no, scissors. That's right. Well, he was born up there or something. Have you seen him before? No, I don't think he's been off the grounds before today. You're kidding. How did you get together with him? I have to go. I'll talk to you later Margie, Bye-bye. I'm sorry Edward, I didn't... oh, dear. May I help you with this?

There you go. Oh, dear, you've cut your face. Let me get this right off. Does that hurt? Okay. No, good. Now let's get you dressed. Okay. There we go. Very fine. You look fine, just fine. Come on, we can't wait for you. You've got rollers in your damn hair. Okay. Now what did I do with my sci... Edward, um, would you. Thank you. I have a doctor friend who I think could help you.
Well, I would, so don't do it!
answer: This must be quite a change for you, Ed.

question: I think he prefers Edward.
answer: Sure. So what have you been doing up there in that big old place? I bet the view must be spectacular, Ed.

question: I was just...
answer: See all the way to the ocean?

question: Turn it up, Kevin. I can't hear it. Kevin! No, make it louder. Sports announcements on
No, make it louder. Sports announcements on
You are all hiding in there like a bunch of old hermit crabs.
Shame on you, keeping your unusual guest all to yourself. We think that's mighty selfish of you.
answer: No, it, it's... things have just been a little hectic around here. That's all.

question: Oh, that was so sweet of you to want to correct the situation. What time does the barbecue begin?
Well, you intend to show your guest hospitality by introducing him to your friends, don't you? And I will bring the ambrosia salad. What time was it that you said?
I did?
answer: Okay, everybody. Grab your plates. Soup's on.

question: I thought it was shish kebab.
I thought it was shish kebab.
answer: Yeah, it, it is shish kebab. It was a figure of speech, Ed. You got to learn not to take things so literally.

question: I can't believe. Everything's still sopping.
answer: If my parents set the alarm, I'm screwed I'll sleep in the yard... again.

question: I told you to call to say we're coming back early.
answer: How else can I be the center of the attention? You didn't call your parents.

question: They don't run their house like a police station. Bye. Thanks for driving, Denny. See you later.
Don't forget your arm.

We'll have you a setup here in a minute. Up with your feet. A queen-size bed here. How do you like that? It's all made up and everything. There you go. What's the matter? What's wrong? She gets you nervous? You've been closed up in a way in that castle too long. You don't know anything about the wonderful world of teen-age girls. They're all crazy. Here some. Straighten that out.
Lemonade. I don't know what it is. They reach a certain age. They develop these gland things. Their bodies swell up. They go crazy.
Now you stay in Kevin's room tonight. Tomorrow we'll fix your room right.
answer: Mom, why did you have to bring him in here?

question: Oh, honey, I couldn't have left him there all alone. You would have done the same thing.
answer: Why does he have to stay here?

question: Oh, my goodness, Kim. I'm surprised at you. He can't help the way he is. Have a little sympathy.
answer: I do have a little sympathy.

question: Then let's just say hello and later you can come downstairs and shake his hand.
Well, not literally. Goodness, you scared him half to death.
Hi, Bill. I just wanted you two to have a proper introduction. Edward, this is our daughter Kim. Kim, this is Edward who's going to live with us.
Bill, you know what Edward told me? He had lunch at Jackie's today.
She's just had her kitchen completely redone.
New paint, new cabinets, new floors, new microwave, new Sonnet dishwasher.
We're getting the head of the company.
Hi, honey. We're in here.
answer: Hi! What did you do to your hair?

question: Quite a story, yes? Any questions for Edward? Yeah, get way over. Stand right up.
Any other questions?
We'll give that name after the show. Thank you very much. That's very nice. Anyone else? Yes, stand right up.

Aren't you excited? Oh, this is just so thrilling. Wait till I show it to you. It's just perfect. It's just what we've been looking for. I want to call it "Shear Heaven." Here we are. No, all along here I'm going to put a row of new mirrors. Back up here a whole row of new cosmetics. All along this row here.

Sure. This is where I stand when I greet the customers. Back in here is what I really want to show you. This is the storeroom for supplies. What I need from you today is to help me make a decision. Don't, that's dangerous. You just sit down right there. I have some smocks. Would you like me to model them? This is my favorite because it's yellow. And what it's for is to catch itchy little trimming that fall down your neck. Then there's this old purple one, you know, you kind of drape around you like this.
Great.
answer: And then she showed me the back room where she took all of her clothes off.

question: Edward. I can't tell you how thrilled I am. I'm just as pleased as Punch. This whole beauty parlor, that's what's going to teach you volumes. There's nothing like running your own business. I've never done it myself, but from what I gather it's the greatest satisfaction a working man can have. So I guess the bank is going to be your next step, huh?
But that's breaking and entering.
answer: Look. My parents have insurance up the rear. Okay? And all it will cost them is a little hassle. That's about it. In a week my dad will have new and better everything.

question: We can't.
answer: Look. There's a guy who will give us cash for the stuff.

question: Jim, I don't want to.
answer: Well, do you want to ride around in a van like Denny's, and we could be by ourselves whenever we like? With a mattress in the back?

question: Why can't you just do it?
answer: Because my father keeps the damn room locked, and we need Edward to get us in.

question: Why can't you take the key like when he's sleeping or something?
answer: Look, you don't understand, everything he handcuffs or ties will do anything for you.

question: What do you mean? That's not true.
answer: Oh, no? Why don't you ask him?

question: That's not fair.
answer: What's fair got to do with it? There isn't any other way.

question: There got to be.
answer: Look. I've racked my brain. Don't you want us to have our own van?

question: Yeah. Jim, the lights are on.
answer: Those go on automatically. They've gone for the weekend. I told you. That's right.

question: You turned off the alarm. Am I right?
answer: Yes, everything, come on. Let's go. Come on.

question: Denny, turn around!
Jim, it's your house. They can't arrest you for setting off your own alarm. We'll just tell them we were breaking in.
answer: I'm not going back there. Okay?

question: We have to go back.
answer: No, because my father will prosecute.

question: His own son?
answer: Especially his own son. If Edward tells, I'll kill him.

question: Denny, turn around.
But can we see him now? He has to stay in prison all night? Oh, Edward. Hello Edward, dear. I blame myself.
answer: What in god's name was going through your mind, son?

question: Why don't I set a better example? You saw how I envied Jim's parents, their money.
answer: What were you going to do with that stuff?

question: Oh, I blithely say, "We'll get money for the salon somehow." But I never meant stealing. Stealing's not the way to get it. Stealing's not the way to get anything.
answer: Except trouble. And you're in a heap of that.

question: He didn't want to talk.
He can't talk right now.
answer: No comments? No remarks? So were you set up? What was going through your mind? One comment.

question: We have to get in the house. We don't want to talk to you. We'll talk to you later.
You're here. They didn't hurt you, did they? Were you scared? I tried to make Jim go back, but you can't make Jim do anything. Thank you for not telling them about me.
It must have been awful when they told you whose house it was.
answer: I know it was Jim's house.

question: You did?
Well, then why did you do it?
Don't.
answer: What's the matter with you? When you are going to stop? I did what I could. My old man think he's retarded, otherwise he'd still be in jail. What more do you want from me?

question: You could tell the truth.
answer: So could do. You were there, too.

question: It wasn't my idea. You know I didn't want to do it.
answer: But you did do it. I don't get why you give such a shit anyway.

question: Good thinking, Kevin.
answer: Well, think about it, you guys, I mean, that's the nicer thing to do. That's what I would do.

question: We're trying to make things easier for him, so let's cut the comedy for a little while.
answer: I am being serious. It's a nicer thing to do.

question: We're not talking nice. We're talking right and wrong.
Hi, honey. honey.
answer: Kevin, you want to play scissors-paper-stone?

question: No.
A few manners? Just never you mind. Just you cut away. Cut away. It needs something else. What do you think, honey?
More bells. Okay.
answer: Mom, do you really think that we should be having this party?

question: Where is he?
No, he did not and you know it.
answer: Are you nuts? I just saw him.

question: Jim. I don't love you any more. I just want you to go. Okay? Just go!
answer: Are you serious? I'm going to lose you to that? He isn't even human.

question: All that blood, sweetie, and it's just a little cut.
answer: Hello, I'm here to see the man with the hands.

question: Oh... Uh...
I'm sure your father will find him soon.
It's almost eight thirty. Great party, huh?
answer: Where are they? God. I hope he's okay!

question: So do I, honey. You know, when I brought Edward down here to live with us, I really didn't think things through. And I didn't think about what could happen to him, or to us, or to the neighborhood. You know, I think that maybe it might be best if he goes back up there. Because at least there he's safe, and we'd just go back to normal.
answer: Now I got up by the Wiggmans, but I didn't see him anywhere.

question: Oh, dear. Oh, just... Well, let's get in the car and go look for him.
He's Max'es.
answer: Where do you think you're going, young lady?

question: Police!
Are you okay?
Where's everybody?
answer: Out looking for you. Hold me.

question: See you tomorrow. Call me, Right? Who?
answer: Oh! Are you ok? oh! owh!

question: Help! Edward help!
